trans-unit.source: Provides data for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.Draw"></xref> event.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.Draw?displayProperty=fullName> event is raised by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> class when the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> is drawn and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.OwnerDraw%2A?displayProperty=fullName> property value is `true`.
The handler for this event receives a parameter of type DrawToolTipEventArgs.

The DrawToolTipEventArgs class contains all the information needed to paint the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip>, including the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> text, the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle>, and the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object on which the drawing should be done.
To customize the look of the ToolTip, use the <xref:System.Drawing.Rectangle> to determine the bounds of the ToolTip, and the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object to perform your customized drawing.
You can increase the bounds of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> before it is shown by handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.Popup> event.

DrawToolTipEventArgs also supports partial customization through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs.DrawBackground%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs.DrawText%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs.DrawBorder%2A> methods.
Using these methods, you can owner draw portions of the ToolTip while leaving the other portions drawn in the standard way.
Initializes a new instance of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs"></xref> class.

The DrawToolTipEventArgs constructor uses the `graphics`, `associatedControl`, `associatedWindow`, `bounds`, `font` and `toolTipText` parameters to initialize their corresponding, similarly named properties.

The `backColor` and `foreColor` parameters are used by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs.DrawBackground%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs.DrawText%2A> methods, respectively.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> context used to draw the ToolTip.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.IWin32Window"></xref> that the ToolTip is bound to.
The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> that the ToolTip is being created for.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that outlines the area where the ToolTip is to be displayed.
A <xref:System.String> containing the text for the ToolTip.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> of the ToolTip background.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Color"></xref> of the ToolTip text.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> used to draw the ToolTip text.
Gets the control for which the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref> is being drawn.

Because the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> can be associated with multiple controls through the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.SetToolTip%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method, the AssociatedControl property can be used to determine which control the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.Draw> event is associated with.
This is helpful if you want to perform different ToolTip customization based on the associated control.

The <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.Control"></xref> that is associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref> when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.Draw"></xref> event occurs.
The return value will be <xref uid="langword_csharp_null" name="null" href=""></xref> if the ToolTip is not associated with a control.
Gets the window to which this <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref> is bound.
When a window is owned by another window, the owned window is minimized and closed with the owner window.
Owned windows are also never displayed behind their owner form.
Here the ToolTip is owned by the native Win32 window represented by the AssociatedWindow property.
The window which owns the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref>.
Gets the size and location of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref> to draw.
By default, the bounds are set by the operating system based on system settings and the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> text.

You can increase the bounds of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> before it is shown by handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.Popup><xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.Popup> event of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> class.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Rectangle"></xref> that represents the bounds of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref> to draw.
Draws the background of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref> using the system background color.

Use this method when you want to customize certain visual aspects of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip>, but want a standard ToolTip background drawn for you using the current value of <xref:System.Drawing.SystemColors.Info%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The background is drawn to fill the area specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs.Bounds%2A> property.
Draws the border of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref> using the system border color.

Use this method when you want to customize certain visual aspects of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip>, but want a standard ToolTip border drawn for you using the current value of <xref:System.Drawing.SystemColors.WindowFrame%2A?displayProperty=fullName>.
The border is drawn to the size specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs.Bounds%2A> property.
You can increase the bounds of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> before it is shown by handling the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.Popup> event.
Draws the text of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref> using the system text color and font.
The DrawText method represents the default method of displaying a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip>.
This method uses the system specified font and the current value of <xref:System.Drawing.SystemColors.InfoText%2A?displayProperty=fullName> for the font color.

The text is drawn as a single line centered horizontally and vertically within the rectangle specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs.Bounds%2A> property; it is equivalent to the following call to the overloaded version of <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs.DrawText%28System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags%29>: `DrawText(TextFormatFlags.HorizontalCenter | TextFormatFlags.VerticalCenter | TextFormatFlags.SingleLine | TextFormatFlags.HidePrefix)`
Draws the text of the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref> using the system text color and font, and the specified text layout.
The DrawText method is used to customize certain visual aspects of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip>, including the layout of the ToolTip text.
This method uses the system specified font and the current value of <xref:System.Drawing.SystemColors.InfoText%2A?displayProperty=fullName> for the font color.

A <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.TextFormatFlags"></xref> containing a bitwise combination of values that specifies the display and layout for the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs.ToolTipText*>.
Gets the font used to draw the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref>.
Use the Font property when you are custom drawing a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> that should use the Windows default font.
A <xref href="System.Drawing.Font"></xref> object.
Gets the graphics surface used to draw the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref>.
You use the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object to customize the drawing of certain visual aspects of a <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip>.
For example, you can draw your own ToolTip background by using the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.FillRectangle%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method.
Any custom drawing that is done outside of the rectangle specified by the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs.Bounds%2A> property will not show up.
You can increase the bounds of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> before it is shown by handling the `ToolTip.Popup` event.

The <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs> class also provides the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs.DrawBackground%2A>, <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs.DrawText%2A> and <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs.DrawBorder%2A> methods to draw individual parts of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> in the standard way used by the operating system.
You can use these methods, together with the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics> object methods, to make some parts of your ToolTip standard, while customizing other parts.
The <xref href="System.Drawing.Graphics"></xref> on which to draw the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref>.
Gets the text for the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref> that is being drawn.
Typically you would use the ToolTipText property to determine what the ToolTip text is when you are custom drawing your ToolTip.
You can use the <xref:System.Drawing.Graphics.DrawString%2A?displayProperty=fullName> method to customize the drawing of the ToolTip text.
If you want to have the ToolTip text drawn using the system specified style, use the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.DrawToolTipEventArgs.DrawText%2A> method.
The text value comes from the value passed to the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.SetToolTip%2A> method of the <xref:System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip> class.
The text that is associated with the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip"></xref> when the <xref href="System.Windows.Forms.ToolTip.Draw"></xref> event occurs.
